newword.meaning:
a settled way of thinking or feeling about someone or something, typically one that is reflected in a person's behavior.
eg: she took a tough attitude toward other people's indulgences
newword.sample: Nobody can stand his bad attitude.
newword.notification: Nobody can stand his bad attitude.

newword.meaning:
a type of product manufactured by a particular company under a particular name.
eg: a new brand of detergent
 
an identifying mark burned on livestock or (especially formerly) criminals or slaves with a branding iron.
eg: Each animal is owned by a Commoner and must be marked with an individual brand before being left to wander the open forest.
newword.sample: Blueway determined to become a leading brand in education and information field.
newword.notification: Blueway determined to become a leading brand in education and information field.

newword.meaning:
the arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement regarded collectively.
eg: 20th century popular culture
the cultivation of bacteria, tissue cells, etc., in an artificial medium containing nutrients.
eg: the cells proliferate readily in culture
newword.sample: Ao dai plays an important role in Vietnamese culture.
newword.notification: Ao dai plays an important role in Vietnamese culture.

newword.meaning:
a series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order.
the boom and slump periods of a trade cycle
 
a complete set or series.
the painting is one of a cycle of seven
newword.sample: No one can change the life cycle of birth, aging, illness and death.
newword.notification: No one can change the life cycle of birth, aging, illness and death.

newword.meaning:
statistical data relating to the population and particular groups within it.
the demographics of book buyers
 
a particular sector of a population.
the drink is popular with a young demographic
